Men's Fencing beat Newcastle to reach cup final

Despite being outnumbered two-to-one, the men's fencing team were ruthless in beating Newcastle seconds, booking their place in the BUCS Cup final later this month (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Wednesday Round-up: March 3rd

Today's sports results from the University of York (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

James put one hand on Emperor College Rugby trophy

Sunday's comprehensive 47-12 victory over Alcuin means this term's Emperor College Rugby Championship is James's to lose (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Arran Bowen-la Grange)

One-sided it may have been, but Varsity's future is assured

York University's 91.25-19.25 Varsity victory may have been uncompetitive, but the staging of the tournament over a weekend for the first time has ensured its long-term future (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

University of York win Varsity 2010

The University of York have won Varsity by a 91.25-19.25 scoreline (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Varsity Live blog

The Nouse live blog on the second day of the Varsity competition with York St. John. Football, hockey, netball, volleyball, tennis, basketball and badminton are today's events. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Varsity football and rugby cancelled

Tomorrow's Varsity football and rugby fixtures have been cancelled due to waterlogged pitches. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Varsity 2010 - First Day Review

Following victories in today's rowing, climbing and swimming events, York University have established a useful 22.25-4.25 lead in the Varsity tournament (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

York swimmers gain early Varsity points

York's dominance in Saturday's Varsity match-ups continued in the Archbishop Holgate pool this afternoon, as both the men's and women's swimming teams proved too strong for their local rivals. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

The Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

The latest edition of our sports podcast (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Positives for women's water polo despite Leeds defeat

York were no match for a physical Leeds team on Wednesday evening, but there were nonetheless many positives to be built upon (Thumbnail credit Action from York's match with Leeds earlier in the campaign. There were many improvements in the home performance from their last meeting. Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Women's hockey bow out of the cup at semi-final stage

A tenth minute Sheffield winner was enough to split the teams in this tense, if uninspiring, BUCS Cup Semi-final on Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Football firsts keep promotion hopes flickering

Goals from Jack Crane and Conor Brennan, plus a vastly improved second-half performance, were enough to overcome the challenge of Newcastle this afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Fabulous Fencers into play-off last four

Strong performances in the Foil and Epee put York women's fencing firsts through to a last four match with Loughborough in the Northern Premier League play-offs. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Ruthless netball firsts overwhelm Sheffield

York's 43-23 victory this afternoon over promotion-chasing Sheffield eased their relegation anxieties at a crucial point in the season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Golden goal winner takes hockey firsts into BUCS Cup final

Dan Alder scored in extra time to send York through to the BUCS Cup final on a dramatic afternoon on the Astroturf (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Wednesday Round-up: February 24th

Today's results from matches involving the sports teams of the University of York (Thumbnail credit The men's hockey firsts celebrate their dramatic extra time winner. Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Rugby firsts denied promotion on administrative technicality

The UYRUFC first XV's hopes of competing in Premier B appear to be over this afternoon after British Universities and College Sport (BUCS) denied them promotion over an administrative technicality (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

News in Brief

Other sports stories happening this week (Thumbnail credit Action from Saturday's lacrosse fixture. Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Last man standing

Henry Cowen talks to Graham Onions about England, the Ashes and his skill with the bat (Thumbnail credit Graham Onions, who Lily Allen apparently fancies &quot;more than Freddie (Flintoff) now&quot; [Credit: Gary_T_W via Flickr Creative Commons])

Novice crews impress on BUCS debut

It was the first time many of them had participated in a proper competition, but the crews of the University Boat Club performed admirably at the BUCS Head event in Peterborough this weekend. (Thumbnail credit The women's eight crews achieved 12th and 15th finishes this weekend [Courtesy of UY Boat Club])

York's sports teams gear up to face St. John as Varsity returns

By James Bithell

fter a two year absence from the University sports calendar, this weekend sees the return of the Varsity contest with York St. John (Thumbnail credit Emily Scott and Gary Milner will lead their sides into the Varsity battle [Photo: Jason Lozier])

Rugby firsts' title hopes hang in the balance after cancellations

York rugby firsts' thrilling league campaign has ended in confusion after the cancellation of last Sunday's all-deciding encounter between Sheffield Hallam and Sheffield University. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Polo team ready to make an impact down south

The University Polo Club are preparing to head to Cambridge for an exclusive match-up this weekend (Thumbnail credit Photographs by Irene Sieberger)

Men's Lacrosse smash Oldham to reach trophy final

A 13-4 victory against Oldham on Saturday afternoon means the men's lacrosse team have a cup final to look forward to in a few weeks time (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Tiger's image not helped by stage-managed apology

Yesterday, disgraced golfer Tiger Woods stood behind a podium in Florida and read a 14-minute statement with the phoney air of a politician. It looked all-too-familiar, argues Jake Farrell (Thumbnail credit Keith Allison, through Flickr Creative Commons)

Eleventh hour Northumbria withdrawal jeopardises UYRUFC title chances

In the latest twist to affect the extraordinary BUCS League 1A championship race, Northumbria University seconds have reportedly pulled out of tomorrow's rugby fixture with York's first XV (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Women's Volleyball exceed expectations at Student Cup Finals

By James Bithell

An overall finish of 14th was York's highest placing in five years as they showed themselves capable of mixing it with some of the best sides in the country (Thumbnail credit Photographs courtesy of UY Volleyball Club)

The Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

The Sports team discuss University and National sport on the latest edition of our weekly podcast (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Netball seconds suffer surprise defeat at Teesside

York's attempts to catch Newcastle at the top of League 5B took a hit after an unexpected defeat to bottom-of-the-table Teesside (Thumbnail credit Sophia Sahin, pictured here shooting against Newcastle last term, linked up effectively with woman-of-the-match Abi Weighill at Teesside on Wednesday. Photograph by Peter Iveson.)
